statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola, Md. 75, Iona 66
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Gerald Brown scored 20 points on Saturday to lead Loyola of Maryland to a 75-66 win over Iona, which remained the lone Division I team without a victory this season. Michael Tuck had 13 points and 13 rebounds, and Marquis Sullivan also scored 13 for the Greyhounds (7-6, 3-1 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), who won their third straight conference game. Loyola set a school record with 10 blocked shots. Anthony Bruin had 20 points and 11 rebounds to lead the Gaels (0-13, 0-3), who led 37-34 with 13:38 left in the game before a meltdown by coach Jeff Ruland helped the Greyhounds take the lead. With the Gaels leading by one, Ruland was called for a technical foul following a turnover. Before play resumed, he was whistled for another technical. Sullivan hit all four free throws, then sank a 3-pointer to give Loyola a lead that it would never relinquish. The Greyhounds' four-point advantage ballooned to 12 over the next 48 seconds. Brett Harvey made a pair of free throws, and Brown added two breakaway layups. Iona cut the lead to eight, but Loyola responded with an 11-1 run to build a 62-44 lead with 3:38 remaining. Justin Marshall scored 18 points for Iona, and Alejo Rodriguez added 11 points and 11 rebounds. The Gaels outrebounded the Greyhounds by six. Loyola led 30-27 at halftime.
